brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to assess the reliability of computed tomography angiography
      (CTA) to diagnose brain death, face of several conditions that make impossible to define
      such diagnosis using clinical criteria exclusively.

clinical_study.brief_title: Computed Tomography Angiography to Brain Death Assessment

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Individuals of any age or sex with brain death suspicion raised, before clinical
             test.

          -  Comatose patients presenting Glasgow Coma Score as or under 5 points, under sedative
             agents or not.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Brain dead patients clinically confirmed.

          -  Contraindications to the use of contrast medium (renal failure or allergy).

study_pop.textblock: Individuals of any genre or age.

facility.name: Hospital das Clínicas da Faculdade de Medicina da USP.

clinical_study.official_title: Computed Tomography Angiography to Brain Death Assessment

overall_official.affiliation: University of São Paulo, School of Medicine.

primary_outcome.description: After excluding confounding factors, we will submit comatose patients to CTA. Immediately after the exam, we will perform clinical evaluation for brain death and calculate CTA sensibility and specificity for this diagnosis. Time between these two interventions will be measured.
primary_outcome.measure: Assess the presence or absence of contrast medium filling of the intracranial vessels in comatose patients.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.
